item.title: Bayesian Prior
item.description: – Always set the priors in the vicinity of what you believe the truth is – Always set the priors such that they reflect the same order of magnitude as the phenomenon you’re trying to predict – Don’t be overconfident, leave space for doubt – Never use completely uninformative priors – Whenever possible refrain from using uniform distributions – Always sum up the consequence of all of your priors such that if no data was available your model still predicts in the same order of magnitude as your observed response – Be careful, and be honest!
